item.name: TCP Sockets In Use
item.description: TCP sockets currently in use on the system.

item.name: Processor load (1 min average per core)
Processor load (5 min average per core)
Processor load (15 min average per core)
CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' proccess that have been niced.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing software interrupts.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The amount of CPU 'stolen' from this virtual machine by the hypervisor for other tasks (such as running another virtual machine).

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

item.name: Buffers memory
item.description: cache for things like file system metadata.

item.name: Free memory
item.description: memory that is readily available to any entity requesting memory.

item.name: Available memory in %
item.description: inactive + cached + free memory in relation to 'total'

item.name: Used memory in %
item.description: active + wired memory in relation to total

item.name: Numer of pending updates from repository

trigger_prototype.name: Lack of free swap space, current {ITEM.LASTVALUE} free
Low free (<1%, {ITEM.LASTVALUE} free) disk space, volume {#FSNAME}
Low free (<5%, {ITEM.LASTVALUE} free) disk space, volume {#FSNAME}
Low free (<10%, {ITEM.LASTVALUE} free) disk space, volume {#FSNAME}

trigger.name: Configured max number of opened files is too low
Configured max number of processes is too low
Cron is not enabled in autostart
Disk I/O is overloaded
trigger.description: OS spends significant time waiting for I/O (input/output) operations. It could be indicator of performance issues with storage system.

trigger.name: Fail2ban is not enabled in autostart
iptables is not enabled in autostart
Lack of available memory, current {ITEM.LASTVALUE} available
NTPd is not enabled in autostart
Processor load is too high (>{ITEM.VALUE2}, current {ITEM.LASTVALUE})
Processor utilization is too high (>85%, current {ITEM.LASTVALUE})
Rsyslog is not enabled in autostart
SSHd is not enabled in autostart
Users with UID 0
trigger.description: trigger checks the system, if there are more users with the UID 0 than 1
